channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.description: A man armed with a gun was holding three people hostage in a bank in northern France on Thursday, officials said.
item.title: Hostages held during siege at bank in French city of Le Havre

item.description: French President Emmanuel Macron has promised angry crowds in Beirut that aid to rebuild the city will not end up in corrupt hands.
item.title: Macron delivers 'home truths' as angry Beirut crowds call for change

item.description: NRA boss Wayne LaPierre and other executives named in lawsuit following an 18-month investigation into allegations of fraud.
item.title: New York Attorney-General launches lawsuit to dissolve the NRA

item.dc:creator: Laura Chung
item.description: Cutting-edge science and doorknocking are being used to help identify bones found in a plastic bag in the Royal National Park two years ago.
item.title: Two years after bones found, forensic testing narrows down mystery man's identity

item.description: European countries are moving to curb travel as fears of a second wave of coronavirus sweep across the continent.
item.title: European countries scramble to halt second COVID-19 wave

item.dc:creator: Clancy Yeates
item.description: A powerful superannuation group is urging boards to rein in executive pay and shun bonuses where companies have launched emergency capital raisings.
item.title: CEOs take pay cut but boards urged to show more 'restraint' in pandemic

item.dc:creator: David Crowe
item.description: Confronting your own party with its mistakes is hard to do in politics. One backbencher is up for the challenge.
item.title: Fault lines in aged care exposed

item.dc:creator: Carrie Fellner
item.description: An investigation is under way into the death of a man whose family were given the wrong medical records and claim he suffered "Third World conditions".
item.title: 'Incredibly distressing': Minister intervenes over patient death and bungled records

item.dc:creator: Lucy Cormack
item.description: Dylan Khqustiaan was a case management officer for the NSW State Insurance Regulatory Authority that oversees icare, Australia's largest workers compensation scheme.
item.title: Ex-employee of state insurance regulator charged over child abuse material, drug supply

item.dc:creator: Tom Rabe
item.description: Manufacturers were desperate to move stock out of Victoria before restrictions came into place, while thousands of tonnes of supplies were being trucked into the state to meet an expected surge.
item.title: Trucking industry saw 'Christmas rush' ahead of lockdown

item.dc:creator: Chris Barrett
item.description: Amid suggestions the NRL could be packaged into a "Netflix of rugby codes", there are calls for clubs and states to be open minded about selling a share of the game.
item.title: 'We need to have a look at it': Souths boss urges clubs to consider private equity

item.dc:creator: Adrian Proszenko
item.description: Des Hasler doesn't normally talk about himself. But as he prepares to coach his 400th NRL game, he granted a rare interview.
item.title: 'That’s always been the modus operandi': Hasler opens up ahead of 400-game milestone

item.dc:creator: Dominic Powell
item.description: Struggling department store operator Myer has been granted a lifeline by its lenders under a new deal that will slightly reduce its debt
item.title: Myer hashes out deal with lenders as COVID-19 sinks shopping

item.dc:creator: Jordan Baker
item.description: Students across the state will write, film and record their views and ideas for a new, NSW Department of Education student voice hub.
item.title: Stop press: young journos hit beat for statewide student news site

item.dc:creator: Stuart Layt
item.description: A slice of Queensland history is up for grabs, with the bulk of personal items owned by former Queensland Premier Sir Joh Bjelke-Petersen and his wife Lady Flo going under the hammer.
item.title: From Sir Joh's car to Lady Flo's recipes: Bjelke-Petersen estate sold off

item.dc:creator: Jordan Baker
item.description: Before the election, the airconditioning approval process took three months. Now, schools are waiting 15 months.
item.title: Four hundred schools sweating on news of airconditioning

item.dc:creator: Alexandra Smith
item.description: NSW Labor is pushing for extra sitting days of Parliament to deal with critical reports.
item.title: Push for extra sitting days for Ruby Princess, bushfire inquiries

item.dc:creator: Angus Thompson
item.description: The state government tried to withhold documents that show bureaucrats concealing Premier Gladys Berejiklian's personal involvement in a council grants scheme now alleged to be the subject of rorting.
item.title: Government tried to hide Premier's involvement in council grants scheme

item.description: Free daily horoscope for each star sign from renowned Astrologer Hedy Damari. Forecasts for the day ahead in life, love and career.
item.title: Your Daily Horoscope for Friday, August 7

item.description: Can the businesses that survived Greece's decade of financial crisis teach us how to weather COVID-19 lockdowns?
item.title: What Aussie SMEs can learn from Greeks

item.dc:creator: Fergus Hunter
item.description: The intervention from human rights commissioner Edward Santow comes amid growing concerns about Beijing-linked efforts to police dissent in Australia.
item.title: Human Rights Commission urges 'rigorous' defence of free speech at unis

item.dc:creator: Mike Foley
item.description: ANU research into the diets of koalas may explain how some healthy animals are emerging from severely burnt landscapes.
item.title: Koalas' bushfire recovery diets provide hope

item.dc:creator: Tony Moore
item.description: Gold Coast tourism had been slowly improving in fits and starts since borders re-opened in July. Now tourism operators say travellers are losing confidence in crossing the border for holidays.
item.title: Travellers losing 'confidence to travel' to Qld as borders close again

item.description: It has taken COVID-19 to spur authorities into concerted action to keep people out of prisons. Now they have a model for fixing Australia's appalling Indigenous incarceration rates.
item.title: Indigenous prison rates can fall fast: here's the proof

item.dc:creator: Michaela Whitbourn
item.description: The state's leading Indigenous lawyers say the court, which involves Elders in decision-making, will help divert offenders from prison and reduce reoffending.
item.title: First Nations lawyers call for urgent action on Walama Court

item.description: It's not clear that Millennials need more feedback and reassurance than people from previous generations, but there are good reasons why they might.
item.title: Do Millennials really need hugs?

item.dc:creator: Lyn Maccallum
item.description: Radio to aid police, city railway link and new comet observed.
item.title: In the Herald: August 7, 1936

item.description: New York's Chelsea Hotel has long been the haunt of artists and dilettantes. Melbourne-born Tony Notarberardino is capturing the remaining inhabitants.
item.title: The Australian photographer inside a sanctuary for rebels

item.description: On this day 70 years ago, British Empire middleweight champion Dave Sands took out American Henry Brimm - 45 seconds after the start of the second round.
item.title: From the Archives, 1950: Dave Sands thrashes American Henry Brimm

item.description: Trivia and word buffs: test your knowledge with today's superquiz and Target.
item.title: Target and superquiz, Friday, August 7

item.dc:creator: Samantha Hutchinson
item.description: The former Australian Women's Weekly editor has bagged many lucrative government clients for her new business venture.
item.title: Helen McCabe finds a rich future for women on Capital Hill

item.dc:creator: Anthony Colangelo
item.description: The second-placed Saints will play the fifth-placed Cats in a match that will pit one of the most exciting attacking sides against one of the most disciplined defences.
item.title: Brett Ratten lauds Saints' maturity, Geary fit for crunch Cats clash

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted by our talented artists, illustrators and cartoonists.
item.title: Best of cartoons, August 7, 2020

item.dc:creator: Karl Quinn
item.description: A staged reading of John Ruane's pitch-black comedy at the Melbourne International Film Festival aims to delight old fans and create new ones.
item.title: Breathing new life into Death in Brunswick, a classic 30 years young

item.dc:creator: Sinclair Davidson
item.description: Both state and federal government are in denial. They seem to think that this is a “business-as-usual” crisis.
item.title: The economic crisis is still to come

item.description: As New Zealand nears 100 days with no community transmission, and with the freedom to share our air and spit in a mosh pit, we’ve learnt things.
item.title: Advice to Melbourne from someone who's done it before

item.dc:creator: Anthony Colangelo
item.description: St Kilda's emergence as a legitimate AFL contender continued on Thursday night with victory over Gold Coast in one of the matches of the season.
item.title: Saints go to second with thrilling win over Suns

item.dc:creator: Cameron Houston
item.description: Several retirement homes devastated by outbreaks of COVID-19 are facing the threat of legal action from angry relatives accusing them of negligence.
item.title: Aged care homes face threat of legal action amid negligence claims

item.dc:creator: Anthony Galloway
item.description: Operators of Australia's critical infrastructure will have to pass on information about cyber attacks to the cyber spy agency under a new security strategy.
item.title: Cyber spy agency to be called in to protect critical infrastructure

item.dc:creator: David Crowe
item.description: Employers will gain easier access to the JobKeeper wage subsidy from the end of September in a $15 billion federal backflip to deal with the economic damage from sweeping Victorian shutdowns.
item.title: More companies to get JobKeeper from September in $15 billion backflip

item.dc:creator: Shane Wright
item.description: Four hundred thousand more people could be out of work by Christmas as the Morrison government prepares for three quarters of negative growth.
item.title: An extra 400,000 Australians out of work by Christmas as lockdowns hit economy

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted in the work of our award-winning cartoonists.
item.title: Today's cartoons: The illustrated news

item.dc:creator: Adam Pengilly
item.description: A morning which started with their State of Origin prop being banned for eating breakfast away from home finished with the end of St George Illawarra's season.
item.title: 'Selfish behaviour': McGregor reprimands Vaughan as Roosters down Dragons

item.dc:creator: Sam Phillips
item.description: The Roosters proved too classy for a Dragons outfit that cost themselves two premiership points with some brain explosions at both ends of the field.
item.title: NRL 2020 as it happened: Roosters prove too classy for dour Dragons

item.dc:creator: Dominic Bossi
item.description: The Sky Blues responded with an improved performance against a youthful Reds side, yet still looked a far cry from their ruthless best.
item.title: Sydney FC stop the rot against Adelaide but still searching for win

item.description: Quaynor was taken from the field on a medicab after a 20cm-plus gash opened up on his lower leg in the fourth quarter when he clashed with Swans debutant Sam Wicks.
item.title: AFL set to investigate possibility metal studs caused Quaynor's gash

item.dc:creator: Matt Bungard
item.description: Melbourne's stage four lockdown has taken effect this morning, with non-essential retail stores shut and permits required to travel to work and access childcare. Travellers from Victoria into NSW will be placed in hotel quarantine from tomorrow.
item.title: As the day unfolded: Melbourne stage four business shutdown begins, Australian death toll stands at 255

item.description: Repulsion, not propulsion, is the helicopter's secret power.
item.title: The hills are alive with legless spiders

item.description: Xu Weihong is the third Canadian to be sentenced to death for drugs in China since Canada detained a top Huawei executive in 2018.
item.title: Chinese court sentences Canadian man to death for making drugs

item.dc:creator: Andrew Wu
item.description: On a night of carnage for Collingwood, the Magpies at least left the Gabba with the points after a vital but unconvincing victory over the Swans.
item.title: Pies down Swans but win comes at heavy cost
